DataElement.preferredName: Linear Analogue Self-Assessment Past Week Average Level of Fatigue Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of the average level of fatigue during the past week, using an eleven point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Linear Analogue Self-Assessment Past Week Average Level of Fatigue Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy._The most recent week, including today._A question about an individual's average level of fatigue._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy.

Concepts.definition: A self-reported questionnaire used to measure general well-being and the major domains of quality of life (mental, physical, emotional, social, and spiritual well-being) in patients receiving cancer therapy.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Average Level of Fatigue Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about an individual's average level of fatigue.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about an individual's average level of fatigue.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created and released as part of Alliance project. mc 2/27/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: That state, following a period of mental or bodily activity, characterized by a lessened capacity for work and reduced efficiency or accomplishment, usually accompanied by a feeling of weariness, sleepiness, or irritability._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11_The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._an ordered reference standard.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No Fatigue To Constant Fatigue 11 Range Likert Score 1

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Fatigue To Constant Fatigue 11 Range Likert Score 1
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: That state, following a period of mental or bodily activity, characterized by a lessened capacity for work and reduced efficiency or accomplishment, usually accompanied by a feeling of weariness, sleepiness, or irritability.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Continually recurring or continuing without interruption.: That state, following a period of mental or bodily activity, characterized by a lessened capacity for work and reduced efficiency or accomplishment, usually accompanied by a feeling of weariness, sleepiness, or irritability.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11: The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.: A subjective score of 1 on a Likert scale.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Overall tiredness and lack of energy.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Continually recurring or continuing without interruption.
Overall tiredness and lack of energy.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
A subjective score of 1 on a Likert scale.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: That state, following a period of mental or bodily activity, characterized by a lessened capacity for work and reduced efficiency or accomplishment, usually accompanied by a feeling of weariness, sleepiness, or irritability.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: Overall tiredness and lack of energy.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
